'''''Mythlore'' 131''' ([https://dc.swosu.edu/mythlore/vol36/iss1/ Volume 36, Issue 1]) is an issue of the ''[[Mythlore]]'' journal, published by the [[Mythopoeic Society]].

==Contents==

====Articles====

* Schmidt, Laura. "Treasure in the Archives: A Celebration of Archival Collections."
* Fliss, William M. "‘Things That Were, and Things That Are, and Things That Yet May Be’: The J.R.R. Tolkien Manuscript Collection at Marquette University."
* Łaszkiewicz, Weronika. "Into the Wild Woods: On the Significance of Trees and Forests in Fantasy Fiction."
* Ivan, Brittani. "‘Countries of the Mind’: The Mundane, the Fantastic, and Reality in the Landscapes of Diana Wynne Jones's ''Hexwood'' and Garth Nix's Old Kingdom Series."
* Vaccaro, Christopher. "‘Morning Stars of a Setting World’: Alain de Lille’s ''De Planctu Naturæ'' and Tolkien’s Legendarium as Neo-Platonic Mythopoeia."
* Bergen, Richard Angelo. "‘A Warp of Horror’: J.R.R. Tolkien’s Sub-creations of Evil."
* Mauk, Margaret S. "‘Your Mother Died to Save You’: The Influence of Mothers in Constructing Moral Frameworks for Violence in ''Harry Potter''."
* Wise, Dennis Wilson. "J.R.R. Tolkien and the 1954 Nomination of E.M. Forster for the Nobel Prize in Literature."
* Rand, Thomas. "''Maleldil'' and Reader Response in C.S. Lewis’s ''Out of the Silent Planet.''"
* Tally, Robert T. Jr. "Three Rings for the Elven-kings: Trilogizing Tolkien in Print and Film."

====Features====  

*Croft, Janet Brennan. Editorial.
*Bratman, David. "Hugo Dyson: An Update (Note)."
* O'Dell, Sarah. "Robert E. Havard: A Closer Look at the ‘Medical Inkling’ (Note)."
* Foster, Mike. "Memories of Clyde Kilby (Note)."
* Flieger, Verlyn. "A Note on a Name (Note)."
* Wootton, J. Aleksandr. Letter to the Editor.

==== Art ====

* "Gandalf in Meduseld" from J.R.R Tolkien's ''The Lord of the Rings,'' illustrated by Sarah Lucy Beach, first published in ''Mythlore'' #35.
* "''The Meditation of Mordred"'' from the Arthurian Romances, illustrated by Sarah Lucy Beach, first published in ''Mythlore'' #39.
* "Eowyn" from J.R.R Tolkien's ''The Lord of the Rings'', illustrated by Sarah Lucy Beach, first published in Mythlore #37.
* "Isildur and the Ring" from J.R.R Tolkien's ''The Lord of the Rings'', illustrated by Sarah Lucy Beach, first published in ''Mythlore'' #36.

====Reviews====

* ''Beren and Lúthien''. J.R.R. Tolkien. Ed. Christopher Tolkien. Illustrated by Alan Lee. Reviewed by Kate Neville.
* ''Tolkien’s Theology of Beauty: Majesty, Splendour, and Transcendence in Middle-earth.'' By Lisa Coutras. Reviewed by Phillip Irving Mitchell.
* ''The Fantastic of the Fin de Siècle.'' Eds. Irina Grubica and Zdenĕk Beran. Reviewed by Douglas A. Anderson.
* ''Laughter in Middle-earth: Humour in and around the Works of J.R.R. Tolkien.'' Eds. Thomas Honegger and Maureen F. Mann. Reviewed by Janet Brennan Croft.
* ''Celtic Myth in Contemporary Children’s Fantasy: Idealization, Identity, Ideology.'' By Dimitra Fimi. Reviewed by Glenn R. Gray.
* ''From Peterborough to Faëry: The Poetics and Mechanics of Secondary Worlds.'' Eds. Thomas Honegger and Dirk Vanderbeke. Reviewed by David Emerson.
* ''The Ravenclaw Chronicles: Reflections from Edinboro.'' Ed. Corbin Fowler and ''Harry Potter for Nerds II: Essays for Fans, Academics, and Lit Geeks.'' Eds. Kathryn McDaniel and Travis Prinzi. Reviewed by Jennifer W. Spirko.
* ''Deeper Magic: The Theology Behind the Writings of C.S. Lewis'' by Donald T. Williams. Reviewed by Diane Joy Baker.
* ''The Invention of Angela Carter: A Biography'' by Edmund Gordon. Reviewed by Dennis Wilson Wise.
* ''Forgotten Leaves: Essays from a Smial.'' Eds. Jessica Burke and Anthony Burdge. Reviewed by Cait Coker.
* ''Tolkien Studies: An Annual Review'' v. XIII. Eds. Michael D.C. Drout, Verlyn Flieger, and David Bratman; ''North Wind: A Journal of George MacDonald Studies'' v. 35. Ed. John Pennington; and ''VII (Seven): Journal of the Marion E. Wade Center'' v.33. Ed. Marjorie Lamp Mead. Reviewed by Janet Brennan Croft.
* Briefly Noted: ''Orcrist: The Bulletin of the Tolkien and Fantasy Society at the University of Wisconsin--Madison #9''. Ed. Richard C. West, Lucas Annear, and Jack Mathie. Reviewed by Janet Brennan Croft.
* Briefly Noted: ''The Wizard of Oz as a Parable.'' Steve Adams. Reviewed by Mike Foster.
